law.catch_line: Criminal possession of forged instrument in the third degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal possession of a forged instrument in the third degree when, with knowledge that it is forged and with intent to defraud, deceive or injure another, he utters or possesses a forged instrument.
Criminal possession of a forged instrument in the third degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 138. effective January 1, 1975.
